creditline: Gift of Mary and Bob Merksy
description: broad black brushstrokes; painterly style; slightly abstracted bird with zigzag pattern on wings and tailfeathers; loops, lines and dots around edges
provenance: The artist, Park Rapids, Minn.; (Zieher, Smith & Horton, New York, sold to Mersky, 2015); Robert B. Mersky, Minneapolis, 2015-16; given to MIA
text: Aaron Spangler is a contemporary sculptor, draftsman, and printmaker whose work explores the sometimes overlooked social and political milieu of American rural life. Best known for his intricately carved wood sculptures and bas-reliefs, Spangler has also been active in the graphic arts in recent years, producing various series of rubbings, drawings, and woodcuts. This drawing is a preparatory study for Spangler's sculpture Songbird (see Mia 2016.35.2).
title: Study for "Songbird"
